source: Buildex Low Profile Roof Clip Fastener Guide
content: FEATURES TEKS® HEAD Head Fastening Proper head style choice will ensure stability during driving, proper clamping and desired finished appearance. Features THREAD FORM AND DIAMETER Threads The correct choice of thread form and diameter optimizes low installation torque with high pullout strength. PILOT SECTION Pilot Section The unthreaded portion of the point assures the drilling of the steel (When Necessary) is completed before the threads begin tapping into the drilled hole. POINT Flute The point is designed to efficiently remove material and precisely size the hole for the thread. Point FINISH Platings and coatings provide lubricity during drilling and tapping as well as corrosion resistance. content: DESCRIPTION/ADVANTAGES TEKS® Low Profile Architectural Metal Roof Clip Self-Drilling Fastener— INCORPORATES THE ITW EXCLUSIVE PHILLIPS SQUARE-DRIV® ANTI-CAM-OUT SYSTEM Fasteners n #12 diameter utilizes the ITW exclusive Phillips Square-Driv ®with patented interlocking components system. - Excellent installation stability. Low Profile - Extended bit driver life. - Keeps the driver securely mated to the fastener during installation. Architectural - Hands-free installation. Metal Roof Clip n Fasteners are finished with a corrosion resistant coating. Teks 3 fasteners are available with Fasteners Gray Spex™ coating. n Sharp convex drill point has precise cutting edges to improve drill performance with less effort. n Low profile pancake head style ensures proper installation of metal roof panels. DESCRIPTION Patented Cement Boards Screws with Serrated Head for Flush Seating Backer-On® cement screws are designed for attaching Hardie-Backer® cement board and Rock-On® cement board screws are designed for attaching Durock® cement board to wood or light guage steel studs. Patented design and ANSI compliant making these perfect for use in high moisture areas such as bathrooms and kitchen. Cement Board ADVANTAGES and Fiber Cement n Serrated head designed to drive flush even n Patented design allows attaching close to edge Backerboard at an angle on cement board, drastically reducing fractures or blow outs Fasteners n Star drive with T-25 bit and Stikfit™ for easy one-handed installation and eliminates cam-outs n Corrosion resistance with Climacoat finish will prevent rust from bleeding into tile n Hi-Lo threads for Rock-On and Single Threads for Backer-On are designed for quick and smooth n Comply with ANSI A108.11 standards as specified drives into cement boards by cement board manufacturers – alternative options such as roofing nails and generic drywall n Sharp points offer immediate pick-up and screws are typically not specified by manufacturers eliminates pre-drilling nor are they ANSI compliant INSTALLATION INSTRUCTIONS 1. A standard screwgun with a depth sensitive nosepiece should be used to install cement board fasteners. For optimal fastener performance, use a screwgun with adjustable depth of drive and variable RPM (0-2000).

d screwgun with a depth sensitive nosepiece should be used to install cement board fasteners. For optimal fastener performance, use a screwgun with adjustable depth of drive and variable RPM (0-2000). 2.Adjust the screwgun nosepiece to properly seat the fastener. 3. Use enclosed T-25 Star Drive bit to drive in the cement board - worn or damaged bit tips should be replaced. 4. The fastener is fully seated when the head is flush with the work surface. 5. Overdrivng may result in torsional failure of the fastener or stripout of the substrate. 6.Steel stud attachment - Fastener must penetrate a minimum 3/8" beyond steel for optimal performance" 7.Wood stud attachment - Fastener must penetrate 1" info wood stud or beyond plywood for optimal performance" B 28 Call our toll free number 800-387-9692 or visit www.itwconstruction.ca for general information. For optimal fastener performance, the screwgun should be a minimum of 6 amps and have an RPM range of 0-2500. • Adjust the screwgun nosepiece to properly seat the fastener. • Worn or damaged bit tips should be replaced. • The fastener is fully seated when the head is flush with the work surface. • Overdriving may result in torsional failure of the fastener or stripout of the substrate. • The fastener must penetrate beyond the metal structure a minimum of 3 pitches of thread. www.itwbuildex.com 32
